alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 3:59PM PDT until March 15 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT WEDNESDAY... * CHANGES...Lesser snow amounts through Monday. Faster drop in snow levels late Tuesday into Wednesday. * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations through Monday: 2 to 8 inches above 7000 feet, except 1 to 2 feet above 8000 feet. For Tuesday into Wednesday: 2 to 8 inches for communities along US-395 including Bridgeport and Lee Vining with 1 to 2 feet for June Lake and Mammoth Lakes and up to 3 to 4 feet along the crest. Sierra ridge gusts above 100 mph by Monday night and Tuesday. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 5 PM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Snow loading on structures will increase due to the additional rain and snow being absorbed into the deep snowpack, along with higher risks for dangerous roofalanches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will vary between 6500 to 7000 feet through Monday, then rise between 7500 to 8000 feet on Tuesday, before falling below 6000 feet late Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. While short bursts of heavy convective snow are expected through this evening, the heaviest overall snowfall rates are expected on Tuesday.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
